channel.title: Wow, this community is a disgrace
channel.description:
This thread is aimed directly at the half-assed bot attempts by some of these so called "scripters"
You're all a bunch of retards, surely you can't put your brai- oh wait i forgot, you don't have brains. Instead of talking in the irc about epic lolzz and fuck all you noobs could be out coding and giving the community another chance. You all think you are fucking leet sitting high and mighty but you know what, you're a bunch of fraudlet, unknowledgable noobs, who pretend to act all smart but are really fucking dumbasses. Code a bot, help the community out.
Fuckers
/thread

item.title: Wow, this community is a disgrace
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’ve been saying we should change the focal point of this community for almost a year now. It’s funny only up until someone flames anything actually gets done.

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:36, topic:170778”][quote author=llib link=topic=230758.msg2022940#msg2022940 date=1201730266]

I think the essay idea is great. But I think for that to be incorporated into the register system, there should also be a referral system, where you must be referred here from a member of the site to be able to join. And in posting the essay, you show your intelligence. And, to make Mopar happy, introduce in-text ads for MoparScape.

Yea great idea 20 cents a referral! 30 if the word “help” isn’t present in the first 20 posts the user makes.
[/quote]

Huh?

I think the essay idea is great. But I think for that to be incorporated into the register system, there should also be a referral system, where you must be referred here from a member of the site to be able to join. And in posting the essay, you show your intelligence. And, to make Mopar happy, introduce in-text ads for MoparScape.

So where are you going to find the people who are willing to read 300+ essays every single day?

I was thinking something like an automated grader. But having a Refferal System in place, people would have to know each other, or be able to contact a member of the site to join. So it slows down the flow of Registrants to a smaller amount. Rather than 1,000 a day, it might be like 50 or 60 a day. Leaving people who might want to read Essays would. And by incorporating the Essays, less people would want to register, so further lowering the registrations per day to maybe 10 or 11.

Now in saying that, I know Mopar will refuse, he has like 1,000,000 members already, he’s on his way to the top. But the useless registrations get annoying. I think that by either making registration more complicated, or having more requirements to join might reduce the amount of registrations, and really only allow the intelligent ones here. Which also introduces a new factor, Exclusivity.

Excluding the general populous from joining, makes the want to join even higher. So I’m thinking, make the community private, remove most of the useless members, Drop MoparScape, or make it unaffiliated with Moparisthebest altogether. And introduce Warez back into the forums, and make the site into a Gaming Appreciation Site. Add a premium member or some sort of Special Rank that you have to pay for. And that’ll be more cash for Mopar. Change the Forum skin to something dark and black, and make this place real popular amongst the rest of the hacking/cheating/modding world.

In doing so you’re exposing the site to a whole new world of information. Having groups of people from every kind of background imaginable. Not to mention Mopar could quit college and live on the money he’d be getting from the site.

Now I’m beginning to get off subject, so I’m done discussing this. If anyone agrees with me, or thinks it’s a good idea. Message me.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Wow, this community is a disgrace
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“error.login, post:48, topic:176485”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=237231.msg2024153#msg2024153 date=1201812646]
Well since my second ps3 came the other day, the one i’m going to use to mess around with, so incase that fucks up i always have my other one
I personally don’t have a wii, but my sister does but i guess she wont be happy about me opening it up and adding shit i think looks good llol.
[/quote]
what a waste of money, you should have brought a xbox and i could have kicked your arse[/quote]

I have an xbox 360, which i bought before the ps3 because it was not released yet and bought it because i was pretty bored and needed something to do until the ps3 came out. So once i got my ps3, saw the difference i gave it to my cousin who used it for a while now he has a ps3 and gave me the xbox 360 back. I have been trying to find a buyer for it but i can’t.

So no, in my opinion buying that xbox 360 was the biggest waste of money for me.

Swordskid61:

yea i get it, but that will be the major part of modding, XB and XB360.

The xbox 360 hacking community is tiny compared to psp and ps3 since sony pretty much support software hacks and other stuff with them giving you the ability to install linux and things like that on it. Heh even the wii modding and hacking community is bigger than the 360s
http://ps3hax.net
http://xbox360hax.net
Note: these are only examples, obviously there are other big 360 modding communitys but overall the playstation 3’s is bigger i imagine.
(all owned by the same person)
Take a look at the difference

item.title: Wow, this community is a disgrace
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Well changing it to anything will have as much success as this community had with runescape. Face it, this community is nothing but a discussion community and all you people will discuss what needs to be changed but will never be willing to go the distance. I am personally bored of reading these types of topics for the umpteenth time. If you want to change the community, don’t go bitch about it in here. Instead, sacrifice your own time to do something worthwhile or get some awesome ideas for Mopar to change the forums a bit and maybe others will follow. You cannot make someone do something they are not inspired or care about doing.

Read full topic
